block.description:
Confluence provider interacts with atlassian confluence cloud service.
		You must configured the provider with the proper credentials before you can use it.

body.description: The body of the new content.

space.description: The space that the content is being created in.

type.description: The type of the new content. Custom content types defined by apps are also supported. eg. 'page', 'blogpost', 'comment' etc.

block.description: The resource ```content``` creates a new piece of content.

description.description: The description of the new/updated space.

key.description: The key of the space to be returned, which is the space name e.g: key="DEVOPS"

block.description:
Creates spaces, space is a container for organizing and grouping related pages of content.
		Spaces can be used to separate content by project, team, department, or other criteria.
		
		A Confluence space typically includes a set of pages that can be organized into a hierarchical structure, with parent and child pages.

key.description: The key of the space to be returned, which is the space name e.g: key="DEVOPS"

type.description: Type of the space is based on, e.g: global, personal.

block.description: Returns a space. This includes information like the name, description, and permissions, but not the content in the space. A Confluence space typically includes a set of pages that can be organized into a hierarchical structure, with parent and child pages. The pages can contain a variety of content, including text, images, tables, lists, and more. Additionally, Confluence spaces provide features such as commenting, version history, and search capabilities for easy access to the content.
